member.name: T:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverExplorerTask
member.summary: NAnt task for automating NCoverExplorer.Console. Using this task you can merge coverage files from NCover, produce xml coverage reports for use with CruiseControl.Net, produce html report files directly, fail automated builds if coverage thresholds are not met and apply a range of detail to the reports produced such as sorting, filtering and coverage exclusions.
member.example:
This example shows producing an xml coverage report at Module/Namespace/Class detail level for inclusion on a CC.Net build server. You would add a merge file task in the publishers section of your CC.Net project file to merge in this "CoverageSummary.xml" file so that it can be transformed by the NCoverExplorer xsl stylesheets you have copied into the CC.Net folder. Here we have set a satisfactory coverage threshold at 80%.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” projectName="My Project" outputDir="${build.reports}" satisfactoryCoverage="80" reportType="4" xmlReportName="CoverageSummary.xml" > <fileset> <include name="coverage.xml" /> </fileset> </ncoverExplorer>

This example shows producing an html function coverage report, excluding the test assemblies. The assemblies excluded are being displayed at the bottom of the report. Note also that this time the reportType is specified by its enum name rather than numeric value - they are interchangable.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” projectName="My Project" outputDir="${build.reports}" satisfactoryCoverage="80" reportType="ModuleClassFunctionSummary" htmlReportName="CoverageSummary.html" showExcluded="True" > <fileset> <include name="coverage.xml" /> </fileset> <exclusions> <exclusion type="Assembly" pattern="*.Tests" /> </exclusions> </ncoverExplorer>

This example shows producing an html module class summary coverage report with exclusions as above. This time we have added applying specific sorting and filtering criteria. This report will show all classes that do not have 100% coverage, sorted within their namespaces by descending coverage %.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” projectName="My Project" outputDir="${build.reports}" satisfactoryCoverage="80" reportType="ModuleClassSummary" htmlReportName="CoverageSummary.html" showExcluded="True" sort="CoveragePercentageDescending" filter="HideFullyCovered" > <fileset> <include name="coverage.xml" /> </fileset> <exclusions> <exclusion type="Assembly" pattern="*.Tests" /> </exclusions> </ncoverExplorer>

This example shows the merging capability to produce a consolidated merge file from multiple coverage test runs. The results are being stored in a single "MyApp.CoverageMerged.xml" file. Note that you could additionally apply coverage exclusions at this point. Merging files can be useful if your testing process requires multiple coverage runs and you want a single archive which consolidates the results.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” outputDir="${build.reports}" reportType="None" mergeFileName="MyApp.CoverageMerged.xml" > <fileset> <include name="*.coverage.xml" /> </fileset> </ncoverExplorer>

This example shows failing a build if the overall coverage % does not meet our threshold, without producing a coverage report.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” projectName="My Project" reportType="None" satisfactoryCoverage="80" failMinimum="True" > <fileset> <include name="coverage.xml" /> </fileset> </ncoverExplorer>

This example shows failing a build if either the overall coverage % does not meet our threshold, or if one of the individual module thresholds is not met.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” projectName="My Project" reportType="None" satisfactoryCoverage="80" failMinimum="True" > <fileset> <include name="coverage.xml" /> </fileset> <moduleThresholds> <moduleThreshold moduleName="MyApp.1.dll" satisfactoryCoverage="75" /> <moduleThreshold moduleName="MyApp.2.dll" satisfactoryCoverage="85" /> </moduleThresholds> </ncoverExplorer>

This example shows using virtually the whole range of attributes. Shown below is failing a build if not reaching the overall or module level coverage thresholds. The results of merging multiple NCover files together are stored as a separate file. We are producing xml and html Namespace per module summary reports (with the exclusions show in the footer). Note that the module thresholds will also be used in the reports. The reports are sorted by name with no filter applied. We are excluding test assemblies and anything in a presentation layer namespace.
<ncoverexplorer program="tools\ncoverexplorer\ncoverexplorer.console.exe” projectName="My Project" reportType="ModuleNamespaceSummary" sort="Name" filter="None" outputDir="${build.reports}" xmlReportName="CoverageSummary.xml" htmlReportName="CoverageSummary.html" mergeFileName="CoverageMerge.xml" showExcluded="True" satisfactoryCoverage="80" failMinimum="True"> <fileset> <include name="coverage.xml" /> </fileset> <exclusions> <exclusion type="Assembly" pattern="*.Tests" /> <exclusion type="Namespace" pattern="MyApp.SomeNamespace" /> <exclusion type="Namespace" pattern="MyApp\.(\w*\.)?" isRegex="true" /> <exclusion type="Class" pattern="MyApp.SomeNamespace.SomeClass" /> </exclusions> <moduleThresholds> <moduleThreshold moduleName="MyApp.1.dll" satisfactoryCoverage="75" /> <moduleThreshold moduleName="MyApp.2.dll" satisfactoryCoverage="85" /> </moduleThresholds> </ncoverExplorer>

member.name: T:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask
member.summary: NAnt task for automating NCover.Console.exe, with both NCover 1.3.3 and 1.5.x support. Note that this task will self register CoverLib.dll using the registry (does not require local admin).
member.example:
This example shows the standard profiling using NCover for standard nunit tests with minimum arguments. Defaults are with no logging, profiling all assemblies, output filename of coverage.xml and this assumes that NCover and NUnit are in the path.
<ncover commandLineExe="${nunit.path}\nunit-console.exe" commandLineArgs="${build.path}\myapp.tests.dll" > </ncover>

This example shows the standard profiling using for standard nunit tests with minimal arguments. Defaults are with logging to coverage.log, profiling all assemblies, output filename of coverage.xml and this example specifies a full path to NCover.Console.exe.
<ncover program="C:\Program Files\NCover\ncover.console.exe" commandLineExe="${nunit.path}\nunit-console.exe" commandLineArgs="${build.path}\myapp.tests.dll" > </ncover>

This example shows using the assemblies attribute inline rather than having child elements, and also showing how child elements of commandLineArgs should be quoted if they contain spaces.
<ncover program="tools
cover
cover.console.exe" commandLineExe="${nunit.path}
unit-console.exe" commandLineArgs="myapp.tests.dll /xml="c:\my results	est.xml"" assemblyList="myapp.main;myapp.core" excludeAttributes="CoverageExcludeAttribute" > </ncover>

This example shows the standard profiling using NCover 1.5.x for a Windows application, specifying a coverage exclusion, verbose logging to a named file, specifically named log, output xml and html files. It also shows coverage exclusion attributes, overriding the NCover location to run from and a way of listing assemblies to be included in the profiled NCover results.
<ncover program="tools
cover
cover.console.exe" commandLineExe="${nunit.path}
unit-console.exe" commandLineArgs="myapp.tests.dll" coverageFile="myapp.coverage.xml" logLevel="Verbose" logFile="myapp.coverage.log" workingDirectory="${build.path}" excludeAttributes="CoverageExcludeAttribute" > <assemblies basedir="${build.path}"> <include name="myapp.*.dll" /> </assemblies> </ncover>

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the NCover version this task runs against. Different NCover versions have different command line arguments. If not specified will identify the version from the NCover.Console assembly. If specified, version should be in format such as "1.3.3" or "1.5.4".

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.CommandLineExe
member.summary: The command line executable to be launched by NCover (such as nunit-console.exe).

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.CommandLineArgs
member.summary: The arguments to pass to the command line executable to be launched by NCover (such as nunit-console.exe).

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.CoverageFile
member.summary: The filename for the output coverage.xml file (default).

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.LogLevel
member.summary: What level of NCover logging to provide. Values are "Quiet", "Normal" (default) and "Verbose". Note that due to a current bug in NCover 1.5.4 there is no different between Quiet and Normal since the //q argument (NoLog=true) will lock NCover. So logging is always on for NCover 1.5.4

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.LogFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the logfile name to write to if logLevel is set to anything other than "Quiet". The default is "coverage.log".

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.WorkingDirectory
member.summary: Gets or sets the working directory for the command line executable.

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.ExcludeAttributes
member.summary: If coverage exclusion attributes have been applied (NCover 1.5.4 onwards) specify the full namespace to the attribute including the "Attribute" suffix - e.g. "CoverageExcludeAttribute" if defined in no namespace.

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.ProfileIIS
member.summary: Determines whether to profile under IIS (//iis). Default value is .

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.ProfileService
member.summary: The service name to profile if any (//svc). Default is none.

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.AssemblyList
member.summary: Used to specify the assemblies to be profiled by specifically naming them. Values should be separated by semi-colons and not include suffixe or path (and case sensitive) as this is how they are identified by the CLR. e.g. "MyApp.Main;MyApp.Core".

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.Assemblies
member.summary: Used to specify the assemblies to be profiled by choosing dynamically from a directory. To use see .

member.name: P:NCoverExplorer.NAntTasks.NCoverTask.ProgramArguments
member.summary: The command-line arguments for the external program.

member.name: T:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities
member.summary: Common utility functions for working with NCover.

member.name: F:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities.NCOVER_PROFILER_CLSID
member.summary: Registry key for registering NCover manually - this will all become unnecessary in future versions of NCover (post 1.5.5) hopefully.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities.BuildTempSettingsXmlFileForNCover(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String,NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverLogLevel,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Builds the temp settings XML file for N cover.
member.param: If set to true profile IIS.
member.returns: Command line switch necessary for passing as an argument.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities.CreateCommandLineArguments(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverLogLevel,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Creates the command line arguments.
member.param: if set to true include formatting.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities.RegisterNCover(System.String)
member.summary: Registers the NCover coverlib.dll by writing directly into the registry under HKCU

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities.UnregisterNCover
member.summary: Unregisters the NCover coverlib.dll

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._ReadNCoverConsoleVersion(System.String)
member.summary: Find path to NCover console and retrieve the version info.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities.GetFileContents(System.String)
member.summary: Reads the file contents and returns as a string.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._BuildTempSettingsXmlFileForNCover133(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String,NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverLogLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Build the Xml .ncoversettings file to pass to the NCover.Console executable using NCover 1.3.3 syntax.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._WriteAssemblyNamesForNCover133(System.String,System.String[],System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Write assembly names as a semi-colon delimited unique assembly name list. Assembly names do not have extensions (how NCover requires them) to match how the CLR identifies them when being profiled.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._BuildTempSettingsXmlFileForNCover15(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String[],System.String,NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverLogLevel,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Build the Xml .ncoversettings file to pass to the NCover.Console executable using NCover 1.5 syntax.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._WriteAssemblyNodes(System.String,System.String[],System.Xml.XmlTextWriter)
member.summary: Writes assembly names as separate Assembly nodes in the settings file. Seems to be a difference in how NCover 1.5.4 handles from previous in the xml.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._BuildCommandLineForNCover133(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverLogLevel,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Build a command line using NCover 1.3.3 syntax.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverUtilities._BuildCommandLineForNCover15(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,NCoverExplorer.Common.NCoverLogLevel,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Build a command line using NCover 1.5.x syntax.

member.name: T:NCoverExplorer.Common.PathSearch
member.summary: Utility class to scan for an executable in all available paths. Based on CodeProject article at: http://www.codeproject.com/csharp/winwhich.asp

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.PathSearch.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.PathSearch.Search(System.String)
member.summary: Searches for the specified executable name in all available paths.

member.name: M:NCoverExplorer.Common.PathSearch._GetRegExString(System.String)
member.summary: Form the regular expression string for the matching file.
member.returns: string that is the regex pattern.
